website_summaries.verdict: This smart plug is a great option for anyone interested in scheduling, voice commands and remote access to everyday devices up to 1,500 watts.
pros: This smart plug keeps other outlets free, works with Google Assistant, and Amazon Alexa, and offers plenty of scheduling and timing options
cons: The TP-Link Kasa Wi-Fi Smart Plug Mini isn't HomeKit-compatible

customer_reviews.title: Not as reliable as regular TP-Link
customer_reviews.text: This mini goes offline a lot and it's super annoying. I have several of the regular TP-Link smart plugs and they work flawlessly but I wanted to get a mini for space-saving reasons. I called tech support and they asked me to do a factory reset. It didn't fix the problem. I called again but they said hold times were long again so I chatted with a tech support person. She had me try to update the firmware but it couldn't find the smart plug on my network. Tech support for this company is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: This product only worked for not even a year. ...
customer_reviews.text: This product only worked for not even a year. I have contacted customer service numerous times! They had me update the firmware, and have me press the reset button for a minute, when I told them that I already did that then they asked me to do it for 2 minutes! It’s frustrating, I will never buy any of their product.
customer_reviews.author: L.C

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: The only reason i bought this was to control my lights remotely. And, each time i have tried that, i get a message saying something about network issues, either not being on home wifi ( why would i wanna use the remote function if i were home), or something about remote function not available, even when i try on cellular data. Completely worthless junk, if you ask me. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, don't waste money on this until they figure these things out.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Has problems!
customer_reviews.text: I have two of the TP Link Smart Minis. One works great but the other one constantly disconnects and I have to go through the set up process. It’ll work for a week and then magically stops. Very disappointed. I may have to find another Alexa compatible device to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: No longer in my casa
customer_reviews.text: More chinese landfill. Mine lasted 11 months. But, it was less than 12 bucks, so throwing it in the trash was not painful. Save your time, $s and frustration. Buy an Amazon plug and be done with it. My Alexa plug is reliably lighting up when commanded. Unlike this junk kasa plug, which is in the bottom of my trash can waiting to add more chinese junk to the local landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Cap'm Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Why so much data usage?
customer_reviews.text: This and TP Link wall switches are using huge amounts of data and may account for why my Amazon cam recordings are so choppy. In the past 7 days three TP switch devices combined have used almost 1GB. For what? What is being transmitted? At another location, one wall switch (HS100) has consumed 580mb in one week? Why? Are these hackable and being used by neighbors as hubs to watch movies?
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Piece of poop
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. It worked for a while then just...quit. The device just stopped responding to Alexa or on the Kasa app. I've spent the past three hours messing with trying to get my smart plug back to being smart again and it's a total piece of crap. I'm done with Kasa. I had even bought a brand new smart plug to swap it out with a new one. Well guess what, the new one doesn't work AT ALL. Followed every direction on the Kasa App and the Alexa App several times to no avail. Basically I think it gets down to the wifi signal it puts out is garbage. Complete waste of time and money. Don't buy one.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gileno

customer_reviews.title: "no hub required" very misleading
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it said no hub was required and I could setup schedules. False. The $200 hub is required for schedules. All you can do is turn the light on and off with the app. The Kasa app just tries to get you to buy the hub when you go to the scheduling screen. Edit: I was able to get schedules working by integrating it with the Google Home routines feature. So it is still dependent on the hub or 3rd party software for schedules. If my inet or wifi goes down, my light won't operate on schedule.
customer_reviews.author: ah

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get the app to install on my two Fire ...
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get the app to install on my two Fire tablets. Finally got it to install on an old tablet that I don't use very much. I got it to turn on and off with that tablet, but would not link with my Alexa Dot. And since linking to my Dot was the reason I purchased this, I am returning it. I guess I'll try one of the Wemo switches. At least their app downloaded on my Fire tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Myers

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: We've got a number of smart products from TP-Link (Kasa) and have enjoyed excellent service from all of them. This smart plug is no different: very simple to add to our network and google home. We have never had issues with any of our Kasa products dropping a signal. They work wonderfully with google home.
customer_reviews.author: Mike KTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were clear and worked perfectly. The integration with Alexa is smooth and seamless. The outlet is a perfectly designed cube with an easy to interpret light. It took me all of 5 minutes to set up. It is a little pricey. I was tempted to get the cheap ones. But this is worth every penny! I love it! These are the HS105 model, which works better than the HS103SP model some other sellers are offering. Check the model number.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: issues with signal and compatibility
customer_reviews.text: does not work with samsung smartthings like their other plugs.. gives error unknown device when trying to set up. /in addition, this device does not get good wifi, frequently disconecting as can be seen by frequent flashing blue light. Maybe due to size as the larger smart plugs work fine in the same location.. Cant get ahold of tech support to see what the issue is. also schedule not working requently as don't see the last run time updated for this plug in the app. All in all cannot recommend, even though their full size ones are great.
customer_reviews.author: lgkahn

customer_reviews.title: Great Plugs
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are terrific, and very helpful in different situations. Many times I have been cooking and needed a light turned on, simple as asking Alexa to turn it on. A couple of years ago I was given one of these plugs, liked it so much I ended up purchasing more, and I have been pleased with them each and every time. They easily integrate with Alexa and they do not seem to lose the WiFi signal. I have never used the timer function because I have Alexa for that, all in all these plugs are a keepers. The plugs arrived in perfect condition, and on time as described. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: BeeBee

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I use this to automatically turn on and off my espresso machine every morning; it takes about 30 minutes for my double boiler machine to fully heat up, so I never have to wait to make my coffee. The kasa app is easy to navigate, and I have it turn on for a 4-hour block every morning, with different hours on weekdays vs weekends. It's also nice to be able to turn it on remotely, so the espresso machine can heat up.... and by the time I'm home, I can have affogato.
customer_reviews.author: RC S.

customer_reviews.title: Here is what you need to know.
customer_reviews.text: It works with any device that once ON, if you pull the plug out of the energy and plug it back it will comeback ON. If your device requires you to push the on button again, than it will just work to turn it OFF but not ON. I’m testing it with my air humidifier. It has a dial to turn on so it works perfectly. I keep my dial on medium and it was easy to install and enable Alexa voice command to turn humidifier on and off. I was also able to control it from work remotely using Alexa app on my phone. So you don’t need an echo device to control this.
customer_reviews.author: Tati Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not good for the long haul
customer_reviews.text: I purchased six of these devices, in the fall of 2017. They were reasonably priced and easy enough to install. However about a month and two weeks ago, two of the devices died. That's very roughly a service cycle of 2.5 years. I don't know what is expected, but 30 month seems woefully short. I replaced them with two Amazon devices, which cost more, and I'll wait and see. By the way, if the home system is already setup, the Amazon devices are essentially plug and play, not unlike the Phillips Hue light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I really like these plugs but wish it had a windows 10 app
customer_reviews.text: I really like these for controlling various things at the house. However, I really wish it had a Windows 10 application so I can use my 2-1 laptop to control them too. Cortana and Alexa for the PC work well at times while other times you have to repeat the statement and Cortana for Windows 10 home has issues while Windows 10 Pro does not with working with the plugs making it less friendly to use at times. I do like the voice commands over touch screen but found that voice is not the best due to implementation of both voice software; Cortana has issues working due to version of windows while Alexa needs touch screen before accepting voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: mlp

customer_reviews.title: Not Trusting Apps That Could Control My Phone
customer_reviews.text: I don't like that no one cares about adding an app to our phones, that can get to everything else we connect to. The concept is what happened in real life with our government and some power plants, or as many books have made up stories about. It's not that the app and device are bad, but it is vulnerable to hacking when someone wants to turn the tied of something in the future and add an update that does damage. Maybe it's to many Si-Fi shows and then looking around and seeing how messed up this world is getting. This is why I refuse to use something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Middleman

customer_reviews.title: These are Refurbished and not NEW items!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product however all three of these that I ordered have bright yellow ‘Refurbished’ stickers on them. Nothing in the title description states that and had I known that I would have purchased newer units.
customer_reviews.author: SC.

customer_reviews.title: Great Item But Warranty Process Not So Great
customer_reviews.text: One of several smart plugs (HS-105) worked great for a few months but, it has now now stopped working correctly. TP Link process for warranty replacement seems to be aimed at at discouraging attempts to have item replaced. Product must be registered. Then proof of purchased must be provided. Then must contact TP Link support to trouble shoot item. All of this for a $20 item and still don't have an RMA. Don't know when or if RMA will ever be issued. I have multiple TL Link products including smart plugs, smart bulbs, and two Ethernet switches. I hope now that they don't fail as I doubt I could get TP Link to replace any of them,
customer_reviews.author: evets

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy and great Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control a floor lamp with Alexa. This was pretty simple to set up, took up only a single plug space on my outlet, and the Kasa app was straightforward and integrated with Alexa easily. A few days after setting up, I renamed one of my WiFi network names and unlike the Feit smart bulbs I have which required a complicated reset process, resetting the WiFi on this was pretty quick. My only quibble, and not one worth docking a star over, is the loud “click” when the plug turns on or off. I’ll definitely buy more as the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: l3bowsk1

customer_reviews.title: PLUG AND PLAY - easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Comes with an app that lets you setup and control the outlet. Works perfectly with Alexa. Doesn't need any extra device or hub to work. Pretty good product without being as expensive as the other options.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Yarrow

customer_reviews.title: So far so awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Works, using it to remotely power on/off ham radio equipment to save electricity. Had the Digital Loggers Web Power Switch versions 1 and 2. Version 1 died and wouldn't even power up. Email to tech support says to send it in which I did then they said it couldn't be repaired and I had to buy another one. I bought Version 2 and it can't connect to the router despite many attempts setting it up once power fluctuates. These Kasa units retain the settings when power fluctuates and after powering off and on then resetting, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I was given one of these a couple of years ago by my brother and decided to order a couple more for my lights. Once the app is downloaded, set up of new units is quick, easy, and relatively headache-free. Of all of the units out there, I recommend the TP link. It may be a little larger than the round units out there but after setting up the Belkins I initially bought when these units started appearing, I prefer the TP link units instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelin51

customer_reviews.title: Installation too difficult!
customer_reviews.text: When it says, "Works with Alexa", I expect to plug it in and ask Alexa to find new devices. Nope. First you need to download the app. Not on your computer, but on your cell phone.Pain in the #$$. Look for help? Nope, "Oops, page not found". Finally got the app downloaded. Part way through the installation, Kasa informs me that it won't install the smart plug on an open network. If I wanted network advice, I'd ask for it. but, I didn't. I live more than 2 miles from a paved road, on a dead-end. I don't get a lot of drive-by bandwidth theft. Still not installed. Just not worth the hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Jack B. Nymble

customer_reviews.title: Great remote control outlet, Seamless with Alexa control once setup
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for outlet and switch controls to use with our Echo devices. This one works great so far, and a great value for the price. You need to link your Kasa Account with Alexa before being able to control the functions with Alexa. However once they are linked it is as simple as saying “Alexa Turn on (DeviceName)”. The timer function works well, and is easily to schedule through the Kasa App. I have not looked to see if you can change or adjust timers through Alexa voice controls. I also have not yet tested the Away feature. One added benefit I found is you can control these devices even when away from your wifi.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Modern convenience
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 now. First one I bought at a Black Friday deal..second one here on Amazon. These setup easily, occupy only one half of the ac wall outlet. You will not be able to plug a transformer into the other outlet when you use this, so you can use a 'liberator' or surge protector for those transformers. These get regular updates from Tp-link, setup easy with Alexa via the Alexa app...and best of all..they retain their settings if you accidentally turn-off the power switch to the outlet or experience a power outage. Also, has power status indicator light (blue or orange) and you can turn it on with the side button if your wifi connection is not working..
customer_reviews.author: Johnny1000

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong version
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this product to work and in the beginning they worked perfectly fine until they started to disconnect and connect on their own...call customer service however, we never got the issue resolved. I also found out that the version I purchased should have been 2.0 stated on the box and the device but in the app it was 1.0 version. I bought this to the representative attention and I was told that the packaging was incorrect and it should have been packaged as 1.0 version. Nevertheless, I sent them back and purchased the amazon smart plug and so far so good plus it was super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Denecce

customer_reviews.title: These things are cool.
customer_reviews.text: These things are cool because you can program them like old school timers. TP link has this awesome Kasa app that you can go into and set timers for these plugs. I’m thinking horticulture! You can see what’s going on with your plug; for instance if you have a timer on, if the plug is on or off, or just simply turn it off with your smart phone if you left it on. It all runs without having to buy an expensive hub as it uses your existing WiFi router.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki Rocktrap

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link smart plugs are more reliable compared to other chinese brands
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link smart plugs are more reliable compared to other chinese brands. They are not 100% always up. Sometimes, they may lose WiFi signal due to the distance away from the router, but more often than not, the unit will pick up the WiFi after a while. Out of 15 Smart Plugs around the house, I only have one that consistently gave me problems with connectivity. It's no surprise that this unit is also the farthest away from the router. My solution is to stick an inexpensive timer before connecting the smart plug and set the timer to switch off my TP-Link once a day. (Timer similar to this one
customer_reviews.author: K Co.

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wifi plug but a little expensive. Hope prices fall down the road and I'll buy many more. Range is great from router. Never kicks breakers or gets hot. I run a high end audio system on them. Including a true 250x 5 amp, and true 900 watt svs 12/2 ultra subwoofer. I use one for the pre amp/amp/game systems/tv/PC area, and one for the subwoofer in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Wasteful!
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this a negative review in hopes that the manufacturer will read it. The product is fine. My complaint is all the wasteful packaging. In the attached photo, the product is the small piece in the lower left corner. The rest is landfill. I also bought two 103 models, physically the same, and they both came in a small, biodegradable cardboard box, which was great. The 105 uses multiple cardboard boxes and a big chunk of plastic. All of which are unnecessary. I assume most buyers of smart home stuff are environmentally-minded, so why doesn't the manufacturer get on board?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless and frustrating - Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This plug is constantly disconnecting from wifi. While the rest of the devices in my home all work perfectly and have no issues connecting (and staying connected) to wifi, this plug is 90% of the time disconnected and "unavailable." It has been a very frustrating experience, so I've given up on it. The only reason I'm not sending it back is because it came bundled with Echo Dot for a fantastic price - it was practically free. However, if you are considering this product, I would strongly advise you not to waste your money or compromise your sanity. If I could give it zero stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: I Want More!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful invention this is. I love love love this smart plug so much. It took just a few minutes to get it all set up using the app and it was very easy to figure out. The app directions are clear and concise, easy to understand. The plug has worked perfectly. No issues, flaws or cons at this point (I've been using it for over 3 months). When I talk to Alexa and ask her to turn on or off whatever device is plugged into it, she responds quickly and boom! Ask and it shall be done. Life made simpler. I would definitely recommend this smart plug!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy set up and use!
customer_reviews.text: I have a LOT of devices on the Kasa products and I am very delighted with how easy they are to set up and how easy they are to program. I am pretty good at technology, but we all know that we are only as good as the technology is, and they have made it easy to do. I can set schedules and control at both my main house and vacation home with ease. I have to admit that in the beginning I had some fun with a relative turning things on and off remotely. After they freaked out, I apologized, but it was funny. I highly recommend their products!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Easy and flawless function.
customer_reviews.text: Hi all. I just set one Mini and 2 Mini Light versions of this plug and they worked FLAWLESSLY. Getting them connected took about 1 minute each. The app is simple and bug free. Which is great. I'd rather have fewer features without the bugs than a bunch of features that don't work. With that said, it does have "scenes" which allow you to group multiple actions into one button. Good enough for me since my desire was to be able to turn a dehumidifier and fan on and off remotely at a storage space I keep.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mei

customer_reviews.title: I love this timer plug!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this timer plug!!! I bought this to use for my Christmas tree and it worked so well that I bought 2 more. The one thing I did wrong at first - I thought it was connected thru Bluetooth but it is through WiFi instead. You can set multiple timer settings. I have the plug turn on and off in the morning then on and off in the evening. You can also just turn it on or off at any time in the App. There are all kind of choices. It is great!
customer_reviews.author: TBear67

customer_reviews.title: No internet = No power to the plug.
customer_reviews.text: I have my fish tank light plugged into this because I hate reaching around to try to locate the switch. However if there is not internet, there is not power to the plug. My internet was out most of Saturday and the only way I could turn the light on was to plug the light into an outlet that the smart plug isn’t using. All other essential functions of the tank are not on the smart plug system because they need to be on constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Melton

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup, easy to use, hasn't failed on us at all, makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: This plug was very easy to install. I had to install the Kasa app and the steps were very simple after that. I used the plug for a lamp in my bedroom that is too far to reach from the bed. I recently injured my back and had to spend a lot of time in bed. Using this gadget to turn the lamp on and off was more helpful than I expected it to be. It's a great option for anyone with a disability or injury. I'm considering buying more for other rooms in our home. The performance has been consistent and we've used it for a few months now.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended...wish I had bought Amazon brand!
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake. I should have stuck with Amazon smart plugs. Every time our electric flashes or every time our wifi goes off, the Kasa plugs do NOT find the wifi signal again...I have to completely delete them and re-input them as though they are new! Quite a hastle, especially if you have one that's in an out-of-the-way location! When they are re-connected, they work fine, it's just the time consumed to get them recognized. I've got an Amazon smart plug that has no trouble re-connecting. Last time I'll buy Kasa brand.
customer_reviews.author: Doughboy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I use them all over the house. Outdoor security lighting, xmas tree lights and pool lights. As the seasons change it is very convenient to reset the timer to turn on later or earlier from your cell phone in the comfort of your house! I took off a star because I would like to see the app include a geographic location so you can pick sundown to turn on lights without having to continually alter the start time.
customer_reviews.author: IROAR

customer_reviews.title: Always disconnects. Useless.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a little over a week now and use it to turn my lamp on and off. Except it never stays connected for more than a few hours or so (at most). I've continuously followed the instructions to set it up several times, but the app always gives me the error that my phone is not within range. I The lamp is right next to my bed and I use the app when I'm in the room. I'm not sure what the problem is, but at this point it is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Works great, set-up glitches
customer_reviews.text: These work great once they are set up. I had to go through the set-up with the Kasa app a few times before it "took". I had to use the web to figure out how to schedule them. I almost returned them when it appeared that you had to buy a hub, but this isn't true. Just stick with it. I had additional problems setting them up with Google Home and it turns out the source of the problem was that my default browser was not Chrome. As soon as I made that change it worked a charm. But I can't hold this against TP-Link. It's awfully cool to just talk to your lights!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Wifi will not stay connected; Smart Actions not available
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the advertised Smart Actions (turn off after a certain amount of time after being turned on). Turns out, that feature doesn't work with plugs. Not that big of a deal as I just integrated it with Home Assistant which has all the functionality needed. The issue is the device itself will not stay connected to Wifi. It's 20 feet from a brand new Unifi FlexHD AP and the device disconnects and reconnects at least 10 times per hour. The live chat support is a joke. Agent will just randomly disconnect, then a new one will connect and end the chat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Used Kasa products for awhile.  Like the updates to their smart plug.
customer_reviews.text: The first kasa smartplug I bought was vertical. It made it difficult to plug more than one plug into the same wall outlet. Now this update makes a lot more sense and is also about half the size. They are also easy to set up and I have never had to reset this one. Of all my kasa outlets and light bulbs, only one specific bulb gives me connectivity issues. So overall good products and easily integrated into Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: WestTxLeanin

customer_reviews.title: Great "cheap" smart plug
customer_reviews.text: Smart devices are not cheap; however, this one is among the good quality cheap smart outlets. It comes with a great app and once you connect it to your phone you can forget about it by setting a schedule or timer (to turn on or off) or connecting it to google home/alexa. I don't have to worry about the app anymore once I connect it to google home/alexa because they take care of the light by me simply asking them to turn on and off the light. Overall, this is a good product to get if you're looking to start making your home more "smart"
customer_reviews.author: bbkim

customer_reviews.title: Constant network issues
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After using this outlet for a month I am slightly displeased. Constantly having network issues with it and half the time it is "Not responding." Which is EXTREMELY annoying to say the least. Makes me want to launch it out the window. TP-Link, GET YOUR SH*T TOGETHER!!!! This outlet works very well. The previous model from TP-Link that I ordered (not the mini) made a loud pop sound every time I asked Alexa to turn the tv off. With this one however, I don't get that. And have had no issues thus far after 3 weeks of use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my entire family
customer_reviews.text: I love this item. Every lamp in my house is plugged into one of these. Now I can either tell Alexa to turn off my lamps or I can use the app on my phone. This worked marvelously on my Christmas tree. The app is great I can create my own schedule to have the light turn on or off at certain times of day. No hub is required only an internet connection. I bought the first one because my husband leaves his bedside light on, falls asleep, and wint wake long enough to turn it off. Now I can, without having to get out of my own warm, snuggly spot in bed.
customer_reviews.author: DebOld

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work half the time. Recommend running over it with your car.
customer_reviews.text: We have struggled to get this plug to work for just over two months. It works about half the time. I just spent three hours on the telephone with Amazon and Kasa tech support. Still doesn't work! I'm not spending any more time or money on an electrical plug! I have now thrown the plug in the driveway and ran over it with my car. Best thing that's happened all day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly quick and easy to set up and configure
customer_reviews.text: Wow! This plug was quick and easy to set up. I downloaded and installed the Kasa app and the corresponding Alexa skill, plugged the plug in, selected my WiFi network in the Kasa app, and bang the plug was connected and added to both the app and Alexa. It's 100% faster and easier to set up than the six Wemo Mimi Plugs I own. I will be buying these plugs going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Tech Writer

customer_reviews.title: Requires app which has unnecessary permissions
customer_reviews.text: Why do I have to download an app that needs permissions to virtually all my data? IT'S A PLUG. IT PROVIDES ELECTRICITY. Kasa for mobile permissions: This app has access to: Location precise location (GPS and network-based) Photos/Media/Files read the contents of your USB storage modify or delete the contents of your USB storage Storage read the contents of your USB storage modify or delete the contents of your USB storage Microphone record audio Wi-Fi connection information view Wi-Fi connections Other interact across users manage document storage receive data from Internet view network connections change network connectivity allow Wi-Fi Multicast reception connect and disconnect from Wi-Fi full network access prevent device from sleeping modify system settings
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity is inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase these again. There are several other cost competitive brands that have fewer connection problems. Pro: Installation and setup of the plug was relatively easy. Integrating it into Alexa was simple as well. Con: These plugs are roughly 15 feet away in the same room as the WiFi router yet they have to be reset (sometimes unplugged, sometimes completely setup again) monthly.
customer_reviews.author: NachoJ3sus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and program.
customer_reviews.text: Had another brand of smartplug it was difficult to st up and had constant problems with it becoming unresponsive and needing to be reset numerous times, especially after a power failure. It also used a proprietary app that only worked with the smartplugs. The Kasa smartplug was easy to set up and program. I also have 2 TP-link cameras which integrate with the Kasa app, giving me a single spot to check on security device. Highly recommend any TP-link products.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Machajewski

customer_reviews.title: Works with Alexa but more complicated to set up
customer_reviews.text: I had bought the Amazon smart plug first and found this one was more complicated to set up. You have to download an APP, set up an account and it took a number of tries to get it set up on the wifi and communicating with Alexa. It has worked perfectly since the set up so I can't fault it on performance - just set up. If you are technically challenged I would strongly recommend the Amazon product. If you are willing to spend some time setting up and this is a better price then it's an option.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie's mom

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Internet Set-up of Any Wireless Device I Ever Used!!!
customer_reviews.text: This Kasa wireless mini Plug was the easiest device I have ever set-up using the Internet. Once it was set-up, it has worked flawlessly from my remote location. Every time I want to turn on my outside security light from my remote location, this Kasa Plug has mad it happen with ZERO PROBLEMS, which means a lot, b/c if I could not turn on my security light remotely using this Kasa Mini Plug, my property would have been unprotected and vulnerable to theft.
customer_reviews.author: JS56A59B

customer_reviews.title: Will no longer work with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plug around ten months ago and it worked fine for a while, but then inexplicable stopped working with Alexa. I have tried re-setting it, rebooting wifi, changing locations around the house...nothing. It still works with the Kasa app, but will arbitrarily stop communicating with the app at times so that I have to go through the whole rigmarole of resetting and reconnecting. I'm very close to just throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: clridenhour

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with tplink and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this smart wifi plug to control my Christmas light outside easy to setup and working great so far and I have ordered a few other items from this mfg tplink and never had issues thank tp link and for the good price Update 12/11/18 just purchased another one for my hard to reach Christmas tree plug. So easy to setup in tplinks Kasa app and it linked directly to alexa app. Love it just ordered another wifi plug yesterday for backup $10 if you order with echo 3 total $39.99 thanks amazon for the great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Krispeken

customer_reviews.title: Always work - in contrast to Wemo plugs
customer_reviews.text: This smart plug is easy to set up. And unlike the Belkin WeMo switches these actually work. The Wemo switches do weird things. They seem to turn on and off on their own schedule. With Alexa, Wemos occasionally don't work. With TP links plugs I have no problem whatsoever. They do what they are supposed to do - all the time. And they are very responsive when used with Alexa. Disclaimer: I don't know why TP-link plugs work for me much better than Wemo plugs and switches. It could be related to Alexa or to my type of internet (AT&T fiber). But either way, TP-link works for me, Wemo does not.
customer_reviews.author: German in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Smart plug
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Easy set up. Please note though exit the app when finished because I can't count how many times my finger apparently touched top turn on a lamp after I pressed top turn it off and the lamp was left burning all night. Great for vacations but set a schedule. Don't just turn the lamps on, you'll forget and leave your lights burning if you become distracted or off you do it while sleepy. My fault. I have them onv schedule and they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple of other brands of smart plugs and prefer tp-link. Most notably they will continue to work if the internet goes down, where my other smart plugs won't. The app used to control these is easy to use and understand. Works flawlessly with Amazon Alexa. At this time tp-link is the only brand of smart plug / smart switch I'm buying due to the quality and dependability.
customer_reviews.author: DouginNC

customer_reviews.title: Just about the best out there.
customer_reviews.text: Used numerous brands and this is just about the best out there. Like the larger GE types that have two plugs but this is compact and light and usually leaves the 2nd plug open enough to still use. Great with Alexa (set up is really well integrated unlike many others) and even though not native to SmartThings, the device handler works great and not too hard to get set up. Also is about the most stable out there, especially in SmartThings. Try plugging and unplugging a WeMo and compare it to this one and this one shines—nearly no delays. For the price—this is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: polyswim

customer_reviews.title: Set up was easy and so far they have worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Bought the minis to use two on an outlet and they fit well. I rarely use the Kasa app; instead I use them through Amazon Echo. Set up was easy and so far they have worked flawlessly. Originally got them for two plugs on Christmas tree lights plus Christmas village on other side of room. The three minis are individually named then set up in a group. Nice to be able to tell Alexa to turn on and off the entire group. No more rooting around behind the tree every night to unplug the lights. Now that Christmas is over, I'll find other uses for the plugs as they are very handy.
customer_reviews.author: KMcColl

customer_reviews.title: Zero functionality unless you create an TP-link account.
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was to be able to turn my desk lamp on and off by voice (Alexa). But in order for this plug to have any functionality whatsoever, it appears I need to create an account (pain), and along with that, give them my location, for them to know which country’s laws will govern THEIR USE OF MY DATA. Why is my smart plug collecting data?? There is no reason an account with TP-link should be needed in order for Alexa to control it. I don’t like this.
customer_reviews.author: JustTheMessenger

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the sole purpose of connecting my lamp to it so I could turn on and off the lamp by using alexa voice command. I know I could have also bought a smart lightbulb but this is what I did. It works great and responds super fast to when I give alexa a command. Only downside is if someone unplugs my alexa the controls like reset and I have to redo everything.
customer_reviews.author: Marina Coles

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a month and then became an expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter’s sound machine and it worked wonderfully for a month and then stopped. Repeated attempts to re-program either fail completely or are “successful” only for it to say “device turned off or out of range” when I try to go and use it. It’s supposed to make my life easier with two littles and I’ve spent far too much time sitting on the floor trying to fix this. Not happy at all!
customer_reviews.author: E. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Smart Plug by TP-Link
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I have mine connected to Alexa and she turns my lamps on/off on command. I will be definitely be buying more becauseI I live in an older home and it comes in handy to voice control lights when walking into a room where the wall switch is located all the way across the room. Its easier than 3-way wiring with another switch, etc... It even works great with my smarthings Hub to turn lights on when activated by motion sensors. Its just convenient, as long as the internet is working properly. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Getachew

customer_reviews.title: Careful when ordering quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on Amazon during Cyber-Monday and felt tricked a bit. Bought 3 units that I thought were exact copies each having an Echo Dot 3 and an official Amazon smart plug. So, The first unit was a combo of an Echo Dot 3 and an official Amazon smart plug. But the other two had a different maker, TP, which I didn’t want and returned the 2 units. Rec’d the refund, then Ordered 2 Amazon maker smart plugs. Cost a bit more overall, but wanted the official Amazon smart plugs in case something didn’t work out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the timer option-easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: I have some old-school timers in places that are difficult to reach when they need to be re-set or if I want to turn off/on the lights manually. I ordered the Kasa Mini Plugs and now it is easy to set-up and/or change the timers. Plus, I can turn off/on lights with my phone instead of moving furniture to reach timers. I can also operate through my Alexa. The Kasas were very easy to install and they do not take up much space on the outlets. I plan to order another for a light I forgot.
customer_reviews.author: MCN

customer_reviews.title: Very good devices.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I needed something to eliminate having to turn a switch on or off to control my living room lights. These devices work very well and, I'm kind of liking just telling Alexa to turn the lights on or off. Pretty simple, straight forward setup. JUST FOLLOW THE SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONS. The Kasa software is only available for mobile devices which, I am not very content with. The software is pretty easy to use but, I would rather have a PC version so my cell phone isn't bogged down with software I won't use very much once everything is set up
customer_reviews.author: Leonardaj

customer_reviews.title: Additional App Required
customer_reviews.text: It works well...after I downloaded another app required for it to work. The instructions were not very clear as how to get it all setup in conjunction with the Alexa app. The price was cheaper than the Amazon Smart Plug but the Amazon plug was plug & play with Alexa. No additional app needed. This plug works well after a lengthy setup.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, useful device!
customer_reviews.text: This smart plug was super easy to set up, and I use it to auto start my cheap little coffee maker every workday morning. I love that I can use the Kasa app to turn it on or off, or give a command to my Google Home Mini to get the same result. I've been reluctant to get into the home automation stuff (since I have a little fixation on electronic toys) but this may be the beginning of a new addiction (I've already ordered a 3pk of the TP-Link SmartBulbs and am eye-balling the Lutron hub for controlling my front porch lights....old house without a neutral wire narrows my choices for smart switches).
customer_reviews.author: CPS

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, works well
customer_reviews.text: Just received this a day ago and it was very easy to setup. Downloaded the KASA app onto my tablet and ran the setup program. Was able to use the app to power the outlet on/off with the app in no time. I then ran the setup program through the Alexa app and Cortana and both worked without issue. I can now control my dining area lamp using three different methods and no additional hub needed. I purchased this used through Amazon Warehouse and will have to buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Better, easier, smaller plugs out there
customer_reviews.text: I have other smart plugs and none required me to download their app to setup and sync plug with amazon alexa. I had to use some tp link app called kasa, create an account.. for what i don't know it's a freaking outlet plug, then pair, setup, then firmware update, then link in echo, then add to my group..etc. and it's big and bulky and i can't get a plug in other outlet other plugs specially a round smart plug, way easier. Alexa automatically found and setup.. not bulky and not as expensive. For non technical people this is not the plug you want.
customer_reviews.author: sectech

customer_reviews.title: Used For The Holiday Tree!  Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This was a freebie with my latest Echo I have no complaints. No hub needed and was a snap to set up. Used it for the Christmas tree and it was wonderful to not have to deal with reaching the lights or outlet. If you have never set something like this up there is a tiny learning curve that even a beginner can work through. It doesn't take long at all. One step at a time and you will be good to go with this and most other Internet Of Things items;>) Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Requires significant personal information to use, then didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The Kasa app requires significant personal information before you can even set up the device: email address, you IP address, and your location. After providing this and attempting to set up the device failed with the very informative error message "Something went wrong". It's too late to return this, so I just trashed it. Strongly not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Schauble

customer_reviews.title: Looks like this will be a good 'smart' AC switch
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this for a month or so. Best liked feature: the smaller form factor. The least liked feature: not very easy to setup more complicated operating scenario's like "Turn on at 4:30 PM and turn off at 10:30 PM". No manual provided so you have to dig around on the web and then dig, dig to find what you need. But I'm getting there. Not to see how reliable it is.
customer_reviews.author: BobM

customer_reviews.title: Just an ordinary smart plug at a higher price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smart plug with auto off capability, other than WEMO. The description of this plug indicates that it has this capability. But, when you configure the plug KASA tells you that you must have a SR20 router, which is no longer available. Tech support is almost non-existent and clearly English is a second language. I am told a SR20 is not necessary but I can find no way to set up auto off, especially since there are still feature requests for this dated this month. So, it is just an expensive version of a smart plug with schedules.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Brodsky

customer_reviews.title: Smart Device Apps are my one complaint
customer_reviews.text: I love this adapter. Works well with my Tap and Echo show. My primary complaint is the same with this and a bunch of other smart devices. I hate that they each have to have their own app. I want one maybe 2 apps and I don't want to be restricted to just one manufacturer. But perhaps the worst is none of them are ever SD card compatible. Their app is ok. Nothing special but ok and taking up more than 100mb with no ability to move it to the SD card (android 8.1).
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brady

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product! So convenient and worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love these things! This is my second time purchasing the Kasa smart plug to use with my Echo Dot. I also purchased the Kasa smart light bulbs and if you plan on using this plug for a light, I would recommend buying the light bulbs instead... if you buy a 3 pack they’re about $13 apiece. I use these for lamps, fans, the Christmas tree...setup is a breeze for the plug and for linking it to my echo.
customer_reviews.author: sarahmarie08

customer_reviews.title: Work better with new routers
customer_reviews.text: I just go the Netgear Orbi router. I had ordered another plug but I couldn't get it to work. Plugs are all set to work at 2.4ghz. I can't turn off 5 ghz on my router. The other plug wouldn't connect. I was able to configure the TP-Link plug. The Kasa app won't recognize it. The Alexa app sees it so all is good using it with my echos. I do turn plugs on and off through Kasa sometimes. That won't work with this plug. Manufacturers need to deal with 5ghz bands on routers.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: Set up in minutes....
customer_reviews.text: This item requires an "account" and an app called Kasa. It was easily downloaded, and the "account" was set up quickly. This smart plug works through my cell phone (using the Kasa app)...or it can be operated through Alexa. I plugged a lamp into it--and can turn the lamp on and off from anywhere (even away from home). This device will have advantages when we're not home or gone overnight.
customer_reviews.author: lindanva

customer_reviews.title: Simple, inexpensive, and functional
customer_reviews.text: We use these devices along with the Amazon Echo to control lamps and a fan. Scheduling allows lamps to turn on and off when we are away. I also use one to turn on during the time I am leaving for work. That way I have light to see when leaving the house and it turns off shortly after I leave. The only issue we have ever had appears to be more of a network issue that with the device itself. The issue seems to have resolved itself. I prefer the mini version since it doesn't block the second plug of the outlet. Overall we have been very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I really love these. Takes about 2 minutes to setup and update firmware. They work pretty well so far. I have 8 of them and use these instead of traditional timers for christmas lights. I also use some to turn on table lamps by voice using Alexa. I have other Kasa smart switches and outlets so like having them all use the KASA app and then skills with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: TobycW

customer_reviews.title: One of the smallest smart outlets I've seen
customer_reviews.text: One of the smallest smart outlets I've seen. This works great with home automation. There's an unofficial SmartThings smart app that you can install on a SmartThigns hub (the directions are searchable online). I use these to automate turning on holiday lights and also paired some with contact sensors so that when I open a closet door, the switch that controls lights inside turns on. And the lights are also set to turn off when the door closes. This does also show usage and the built in app does have some automation baked in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Been really great!!
customer_reviews.text: I have both this mini and the bigger plug and both have worked flawlessly. Eerily flawless. I’ve recommended them to others countless times. Important to note that I have no clue what my WiFi ghz is, 5 or 2.4. I have an eero system and I think it does all that in the background. I did hear that a person I recommended it had an issue with 2.4 but I think that also goes for other electronics so you should research that on your own. Extra plus for no hubs needed!
customer_reviews.author: Steve P.

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to get
customer_reviews.text: After ordering one that didn't work I spent about three hours researching and reading reviews until I came across this one. This is most definitely the one to get, real easy to setup. It will only hook up to a 2.5 gigahertz frequency wifi router, so if you're having a hard time getting it to connect it's either that or a bad unit. It happens from time to time, I really wish they would quality assurance test these before they send them out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Product stopped connecting to WIFI after 4 mths
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product bundled with Echo. The TP link plug stopped responding to Alexa command completely, on checking the wifi stopped responding and is not working. It is not usable anymore. I also purchased the amazon smart plug at the same time and that is working without any issue. if you want to own a smart plug, this is not the one, these are expensive items and if it breaks and is outside return window, nothing can be done about it.
customer_reviews.author: marc

customer_reviews.title: Terrific gadget! Watch out: Misleading instructions in the box! It works with dual-band (2.4/5 GHz) routers.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions that came with the item state that it only works with a 2.4-GHz router. This information is missing from the webpage's product block. So I started to go through the return process (my router's set to 5 GHz), stopped, and found by searching the customers' comments (thanks to you!!) that dual-band routers work (should've known, but who remembers this stuff?). Connecting to the WiFi using the Kasa app was easy as was everything else. The app is well-designed and intuitive. This is a "cool" device, although a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: GarageBoy

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Amazon and tp-link must have a great relationship. However if you have a fire tablet you can't use it to download the required app to use this product. It is available on Google play but not in the Amazon app store. I wish I could give this product zero stars since it is useless to me. I know you can add Google play to the Fire tablet but it is complicated and you shouldn't have to. Don't support companies that don't support you. Let them go out of business.
customer_reviews.author: William Smith

customer_reviews.title: My favorite smart outlet adapter
customer_reviews.text: I have three or four of these. I like them much better than the similar iHome or amazon branded ones that are bigger. I bought my first one two years ago and haven’t had any trouble with any of them. Two of them I use of two different Christmas trees in our house. They integrate well with Google Home and Samsung SmartThings. I had timers set up for the ones that control our Christmas trees through SmartThings. The third I use for a tiny lamp on a table in our foyer that uses a tiny bulb that they don’t make in a smart bulb. I have no complaints about these over the past two years.
customer_reviews.author: Cheesehead84

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these plugs and all are working just fine. After setup I have not really messed with them since I have them on timers mostly. Occasionally I will ask for one of the plugs to turn on or off via Alexa and that works as expected. I would recommend these as an easy indoor timer that you can control with smart device if you need too.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great product & good connections to wifi.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great, I can use it anywhere in the house and has reliable wifi connections. The Kasa app is also great & user friendly. Setup schedules, timers & location for when I want the power on or off. I've bought 2 so far and plan on buying the tp-link 6 outlet power strip soon!
customer_reviews.author: Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and even worse support.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this. Mine worked for maybe ten uses and stopped working. SO I went to TP link's website and tried to request a replacement, but the website says that my serial number is invalid. So I contact support and tell them the story and they tell me it should be replaced and lead me right back to the same portal that didn't work before. They did not address the serial number issue at all. Terrible product and even worse support.
customer_reviews.author: danlunatic

customer_reviews.title: This TP-Link switched outlet is easy to set up and takes care of my lights.
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 kinds of WiFi switched outlets and this one was the easiest to setup. I used my smartphone to set an on/off schedule and in 2 minutes it was working as I asked. The program has a feature to turn on the outlet for my entry lamp at sunset, so I don't need to keep changing the "on" time as the days get longer. The outlet (lamp) will shut off at my prescribed time but I can just tell Alexa to shut off the light at any time. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with Alexa, needs Internet connection
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and two of the bigger ones. I use these when I know I really don't need to use the manual button on the side and want something small. Works great and I love them. I've been using them for about 4-5 months now with Amazon Alexa, and my wife is so used to them that she is asking Alexa to turn things on and off that haven't even been connected yet! How fast we get used to convenience. It's very nice to be able to turn lights on and off without having to go into the room. From our bedroom we can turn lights on and off throughout the house. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Uranium Steel

customer_reviews.title: Won't work out of the box, you have to pay another $ and add another app
customer_reviews.text: I have to return this. It won't work unless you add the KASA app. It took me an hour on the phone with India just to get the Echo Dot to work, and I'm not going to add an outside app to a system that is already in precarious balance. The KASA app only costs another 99 cents -- but who cares? Amazon's writeup makes it seem that all you have to do is give Alexa a simple command and it will work with this device. The manufacturer says otherwise. Bah, say I.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was quick and easy! Finally, we can easily turn off and on the inconveniently located living room lamp! It DOES require you install Kasa's app on your smartphone, and from there you can integrate into your Google Home (or, I presume, some other system - but Home is what I use). The app info in the instructions was a little out of date, but it wasn't a big hurdle to getting it all set up. Once I got the outlet linked to my Home, I stopped using the app entirely and only ever use voice commands to turn it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie B.

customer_reviews.title: If you lose internet connection temporarily, it stops working.
customer_reviews.text: The plug is OK, I guess, but if you ever lose connectivity, even for a minute, then the little blue light goes red, and they stop working until you unplug and re-plug them. This shouldn't be the case: Myreconnects afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: dclaar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with Alexa!!
customer_reviews.text: Will NOT connect to Alexa! For me, that makes it useless, and this is the second TP Link Kasa smart plug that won't connect to Alexa, while other smart plugs will connect. Both of the Kasa smart plugs were just about 5 feet from a perfectly functioning wireless router, and while they would connect to the Kasa app, they refuse to connect with Alexa after numerous attempts. Meanwhile, a much cheaper smart plug connected with Alexa on the first try. Don't buy...!!
customer_reviews.author: mthomas540

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set-Up
customer_reviews.text: Set-up was no problem. Can tell my living room device to turn on my bedroom light and the light is on before I get there. Then I can get settled in bed and tell my bedroom device to turn off the night and it goes off with me remaining nice and cozy/settled. Actually purchased a second outlet. Extremely convenient. Got the second during a Lighting sell on Prime Day for $4.99. Truly enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: K.Miller

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart Plug by TP-Link, Smart Home WiFi Outlet works with Alexa, Echo,Google Home & IFTTT,No Hub Required, Remote Control, 15 Amp, UL certified, 1-Pack (HS105)
product_meta.description: Style:1 PackControl lighting and other appliances from anywhere with the Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Plug mini. Schedule connected devices turn on when you get home, then power down when you go to sleep. Control each outlet individually or as one, set schedules or scenes, even use voice commands with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, or Microsoft Cortana. Frequency Range: 2.4GHz; Protocols Supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n. Operating Temperature: 0 ºC~ 40 ºC ( 32°F ~ 104°F ).
feature_bullets: Control From Anywhere: Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app (Compatible w/ Android & iOS)
Voice Control: Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and MicroSoft Cortana supported devices for a hands free experience
Compact Design: Won't block the other wall outlet allowing two Smart Plugs to be installed side by side
Kasa scenes & schedules: Schedule the Smart plug to automatically switch on and off when away or set a scene for controlling many devices with a single button
Note: Requires a secured 2.4 GigaHertz Wi Fi network connection

specifications.Included Components: Smart Wi-Fi Plug Mini HS105, Quick Start Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars8,958 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
